headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  WANGH, ANNE WILSON

snippet: WANGH--Anne Wilson. (nee Wolfson), died June 7th. 97, ballerina, pupil of Michel Fokine, soloist American Ballet Theatre, founder Dance Library of Israel; choreographer, notably of "The Ballet Story," lecturer, dance therapist, master of Laban notation. Anne was an activist for peace and social justice. Married to Martin Wangh, psychoanalyst for sixty years. She is survived by sons, Stephen, Lawrence, and Mitchell and their wives, Suzanne, Katherine and Jo-Ann. The beloved Granny Anny of Jacob, Rebecca, Noah, Marina, Megan and Hannah and their spouses, Kate, Brice, Krace, Jack, and Deann and great-grandchildren, Alea, Ruben, Neva, Oliver, Lionel and Finley. Donations to the Dance Library of Israel. 1/3
lead_paragraph: WANGH--Anne Wilson. (nee Wolfson), died June 7th. 97, ballerina, pupil of Michel Fokine, soloist American Ballet Theatre, founder Dance Library of Israel; choreographer, notably of "The Ballet Story," lecturer, dance therapist, master of Laban notation. Anne was an activist for peace and social justice. Married to Martin Wangh, psychoanalyst for sixty years. She is survived by sons, Stephen, Lawrence, and Mitchell and their wives, Suzanne, Katherine and Jo-Ann. The beloved Granny Anny of Jacob, Rebecca, Noah, Marina, Megan and Hannah and their spouses, Kate, Brice, Krace, Jack, and Deann and great-grandchildren, Alea, Ruben, Neva, Oliver, Lionel and Finley. Donations to the Dance Library of Israel. 1/3
